title: No Parties
body: Due to neighborhood restrictions, parties are not allowed in this home. Disregarding this rule will result in immediate eviction.

title: Check-out Information
body: Check-out is at 10:00 am. We hope you had a wonderful stay.

title: No Smoking
body: No smoking is allowed on the premises. If smoking does occur on the premises, Guest may be evicted and is financially responsible for all damage caused by the smoking including, but not limited to, stains, burns and the cost of odor remediation and removal and replacement of damaged property.

title: Noise and Neighbors
body: Please be aware that even normal conversation amplifies off the buildings in higher density neighborhoods. As a courtesy to your neighbors, please minimize loud conversation, music, and general noise, especially after 10:00 pm. Please be respectful at all times, and be aware that the San Diego Noise Ordinance is strictly enforced. Neighbors will notify Bluewater and/or the police regarding disturbances. If Law Enforcement is dispatched due to any illegal activities or disturbances originating from the property, it is considered grounds for fines and/or immediate eviction. If any neighbors are disturbing you, please call Bluewater during normal business hours, or the San Diego Police after-hours.

title: Safety & Security
body:
Vacating the home quickly can be very important in case of an emergency. Please ensure all occupants take a moment to become familiar with the layout of the home and identify all exit routes.
Although, this is generally a safe neighborhood, there are some basic precautionary steps you can take to make sure your stay remains stress-free. Don’t leave items unattended outside or in open garages. Don’t leave any valuables in outside or in plain sight, keep car doors locked, and make sure to lock all windows and doors when leaving the home. If you see any suspicious activity, call 911.

title: Hot Tub and/or Pool
body: The house has a private hot tub.

title: Inventory/Starter Kits
body:
You will find the home is stocked with all the basics:

- Ready-made beds and at least 1 bath towel, hand towel and wash cloth per guest
- Kitchen stocked with glasses, dishes, and utensils, as well as basic cookware
- The kitchen starter kit includes: hand soap, sponge, dish soap, dishwasher tabs, a roll of paper towels, and kitchen trash bags 
- Each bathroom is equipped with a starter kit which includes a hotel-style set of bath soap, shampoo, conditioner, and two rolls of toilet paper
- Laundry detergent 

The starter kits provided are complimentary and are meant to cover your needs before you get to the store to do your shopping. You may find supplies that have been left by other guests which you are welcome to use, but make sure to take a quick inventory before you shop to ensure you have everything you will need during your stay.

title: Accidental Damages
body: Your rental agreement includes a security deposit protection plan. The home will be inspected after departure. Please make sure that you notify Bluewater of any damages prior to departure, otherwise, the security deposit protection is void and your credit card will be charged for the cost of repair/replacement. The most common damages include stains on towels, linens, and carpet. If damage is found to be excessive, or caused by negligence it will not be covered under the policy.

title: Garbage Disposal
body: Please discard leftover food into the garbage. The garbage disposal cannot accept the following items: Artichokes, Egg Shells, Fat or Grease, Potato Skins, Rice, Banana Skins, Celery, Onion Skins, Avocado Seeds, Corn husks

title: Fire Extinguisher & First Aid Kit
body: Located under the kitchen sink. Please notify us if you cannot locate.

title: BBQ
body: After every use, be sure to wipe down the BBQ and ensure the valves are closed tightly. BBQ is for adult use only.

title: Guest Access
body:
*To Unlock:* Enter the code  [DoorCode] then press the bottom left button (either a checkmark or * )
*To Lock:* Press any button once you have closed the door and the door will lock.

title: Feedback
body: How is everything? We want to make sure the home is perfectly clean, and stocked with everything you need. If you need anything or something is not to your satisfaction, please email your request or concerns to guests@bwvh.com, or call our Guest Services Representative at 858-605-1497. Thank you!

title: Check-In
body:
*Check-in time is 4:00 pm and check-out is 10:00 am.*

Your door code will not be active until 4:00 pm. 

Please do not arrive to the home before your check-in time as cleaners and other staff may be in the home and using the parking spaces.

*Early Arrivals*
While we would love to accommodate all early arrivals, we are typically not able to do so. Please email guests@bwvh.com if you'd like to put in a request and you will be notified on the day of check in if we are able to grant early access. Otherwise, please plan on the 4 PM check-in time.

*Late Arrivals*
If you plan on arriving after our office closes at 6:00 pm, please contact us in advance at 858-605-1497 or guests@bwvh.com

*Storing Luggage*
If you do not want to carry your luggage around until check-in time, please look into using Luggage Hero for all your luggage storing and delivery needs - https://luggagehero.com/

title: Welcome to your vacation!
body:
Below are your check-in instructions and directions to the home. This guide includes how to access the home and local information to help make your stay more enjoyable. 
NOTE: If you haven't already, please email guests@bwvh.com with the email addresses of everyone in your group and we will share these instructions so they will have the code and house instructions handy on their phone.

title: Book your return visit direct with Bluewater and save!
body: We love our repeat guests and can't wait for your return! Click on this link to see future availability on this home or browse all of our homes *[here](https://www.bluewatervacationhomes.com)* . Depending on the time of year and home you choose,  we can offer you a repeat guest discount. Please email inquiries@bwvh.com with the last name on your reservation and your requested dates of stay for more information.

title: WIFI
body:
[PmsUnitsWifi]

The network name is  ** and the password is **. If you are experiencing problems, contact Bluewater Vacation Homes at 858-605-1497 for additional assistance.

title: Laundry
body: There is a washer and dryer are located ______. Please clean the dryer trap after every use. An initial supply of laundry detergent is supplied for your convenience. Please do not use bleach in the home. Stains left because of bleach use will not be covered under your vacation rental damage protection.

title: Checkout Procedures
body:
When it’s time to leave, we recommend checking closely for personal items with a room by room sweep, including all drawers, cabinets, closets, under the beds, and outlets (for chargers), etc.
 
Please leave the property in the same general condition you found it at Check-In, meaning:
 
-Trash picked up and removed from the home
-Discard any perishables, however, you are welcome to leave unopened food or drinks for donation.
-Dishes are cleaned and put away, or started in the dishwasher
-Any cooking messes are cleaned up
-Used towels are placed in the bath tubs or showers (linens can be left in bedrooms)
-Replace any furniture or items that have been rearranged (interior and exterior)
-TV remote controls left in their appropriate rooms in plain sight
-Keys and garage remotes (if applicable) left on the kitchen counter
-Turn-off all lights, air conditioner, heater, fans, etc.
-  *Please make sure all the doors and windows are locked upon departure.*
 
**Please note: Late departures that are not pre-approved in writing, homes that are left excessively dirty, and missing remotes and keys will result in additional charges**
 
Please let us know if you have any questions and thank you for staying with Bluewater!

title: Environmental Considerations
body: Southern California has an arid climate and typically experiences drought conditions. Water restrictions are in effect, so please conserve water accordingly. *When leaving the property, please turn off any extra lights and turn down the heater to save electricity*. Thank you very much!

title: Emergencies
body: Please call our office at 858-605-1497 if you have any maintenance emergency. Call 911 in case of fire or other emergencies. In the event of a fire or any major issues, please contact us after everyone is safe.

title: Outdoor Furniture
body: When the BBQ and outdoor furniture are not in use we ask that you please use the covers to protect from the elements. Thank you!

title: Late Checkout
body: If you would like to request a late checkout, please contact our office before 6pm the day before your departure to see if we are able to grant this for you.

title: Miscellaneous Items
body:
- When returning home from the beach, please rinse all sand off outside and shake out towels, etc. prior to entering the home.
- Please do not smoke on the premises.
- Due to safety concerns, please do not light candles.
- No pets allowed on premises, we provide allergen free homes.
- Personal belongings such as bikes, chairs, coolers, towels, etc. should be put in the house or garage for security. 
- The bikes and other beach equipment locked in the garage are the private property of the owners and not for guest use. Please see our Vendor Partners email for a list of vendors who can help you with renting such items.

title: Recycling
body: The environment is everyone’s concern and recycling plays an important part of helping conserve. However, due to certain constraints, some homes may not have recycling bins. In the beach alleys, recycling bins attract scavengers who rummage through the bins late at night to illegally collect recyclables, leaving strewn trash behind. In such high-density communities, sometimes there isn’t enough room for trash and recycle bins, so others will place refuse in the recycle bins and the city will not empty those containers, leading to unsanitary conditions. We have tried locking the bins, but if guests do not unlock in time for collection, the bins will stay full and there is not enough room for overflow. We are petitioning the city for other solutions and apologize for any inconvenience this may cause you. If you have any concerns or suggestions, we welcome your call.

title: Coffee Maker
body: We provide standard multi-cup drip coffee makers in our homes.

title: Parking
body:
The garage keypad is located on the east side of the garage. *Code: 7764 UP arrow (to open) 7764 DOWN arrow (to close)*.  The garage can accommodate 1 car and the driveway can accommodate 1 car please be mindful to stay behind the red line when parking in the driveway. If you have additional vehicles, you will need to find street parking on Mission Blvd. Be mindful of street parking restrictions!

Garage height 83 inches (Almost 7ft).
Width 166 inches (almost 14ft). 
Length 19ft.

HxWxL = 7ft  x 14ft x 19ft

title: Laundry
body: There is a washer and dryer are located in a small room on the second floor across from the hallway bathroom. Please clean the dryer trap after every use. An initial supply of laundry detergent is supplied for your convenience. Please do not use bleach in the home. Stains left because of bleach use will not be covered under your vacation rental damage protection.

title: Address
body: 3879 Ocean Front Walk, San Diego, CA 92109

title: WIFI
body: The network name is  *SpectrumSetup-84* and the password is *salutebridge149*. If you are experiencing problems, contact Bluewater Vacation Homes at 858-605-1497 for additional assistance.

title: Outdoor Furniture
body: When the outdoor furniture is not in use we ask that you please use the covers to protect from the elements. Outdoor furniture covers are located in the cabinet under the BBQ. There are also additional chairs in the garage for use. Please return when done using them. Especially at night! Thank you!

title: Trash
body: The trash bins are in the alley across from the home. The cans are labeled with address. Collection day for trash is Tuesday and recycling is every other Tuesday.  A valet service will bring bins in and out to the street on collection days. Please contact Bluewater with any questions, or if you need the bins emptied during your stay.

title: Guest Access
body:
To access the home, enter through the garage door the garage keypad is located on the east side of the garage. *Code: 7764 UP arrow (to open) 7764 DOWN arrow (to close)*. Once inside the garage use your Door Code (listed below these instructions) on the door keypad to enter the home. 

*To Unlock:* Enter the code  [DoorCode] then press the bottom left button (either a checkmark or * )
*To Lock:* Press any button once you have closed the door and the door will lock.

title: Hot Tub and/or Pool
body:
The spa is located on the ground level of the home. To heat the spa press the heat button and adjust up or down to desired temperature. When done adjust temperature back down to resting comfortable resting temperature. Ensure all sand is rinsed before entering the spa. Cover spa when not in use. Please be careful when using the Spa. 
**Spa Heat is complimentary**

title: TV & Electronics
body:
*All TV’s:*
Roku TV’s – press Power and then select streaming app. Spectrum Cable TV app is included, please use your own login for all other apps. Be sure to log out of your accounts at the end of your stay!

title: Walkthrough Home
body: Please contact us 20 minutes before arriving to confirm time for a representative to meet you at the home for a walk through. If you will be arriving after 5 PM please make sure to let us know well in advance.

title: Unique To This Home
body:
*Spa Vendor* - Every Tuesday

*Showers and Hot Water*
Please allow 3-4 minutes for hot water in showers, there is a long run from the water heater. Each shower has operation instruction labels for use.

*Miele Range* 
Note when lighting burners the ignitor clicks and then stop after approx. 7 seconds. 

*Fire Pit*
The fire pit key is in top kitchen drawer by garage door. Turn the key in fire pit counterclockwise and hold down igniter button until it lights. To turn off rotate clockwise.

title: BBQ
body: There is a gas BBQ located on the third floor. To light the grill, push the knob in and turn counterclockwise. After every use, be sure to wipe down the BBQ. BBQ is for adult use only.

title: Directions
body:
*FROM MISSION BLVD:* Turn right on San Rafael Pl., turn left on Strandway, turn right at the green house on the corner. The home is directly in front and the garage is on the right.  

*FROM WESTBOUND I-8:* Exit Sports Arena Blvd/West Mission Bay Drive. Turn right go over the bridge and after ½ mile, keep right and follow the signs to West Mission Bay Drive, keep right and exit West Mission Bay Drive, and go 1.5 miles to Mission Blvd (at the roller coaster). See FROM MISSION BLVD. above.

*FROM NORTHBOUND I-5 (Airport):* Follow the signs from the airport and to Interstate 5 North, then take I8 West/Beaches, and take the first exit, Sports Arena/West Mission Bay Drive. Turn right, go over the bridge, keep right and follow the signs to West Mission Bay Drive. Go 1.5 miles to Mission Blvd. (at the roller coaster). See FROM MISSION BLVD. above.

*FROM SOUTHBOUND I-5:* Take Exit 21, Sea World Drive, turn right for 1.9 miles, past Sea World, keep right and exit West Mission Bay Drive; stay right to keep on West Mission Bay Drive for 1.5 miles, this will bring you to Mission Blvd (At the roller coaster). See FROM MISSION BLVD. above.
